author: milos88
content:
I would like to contribute to Ethereum development, but I'm not sure how to start. Last few weeks I was lurking around the server, trying to figure out and learn more about ongoing/upcoming projects.

Is there any team that needs help at the moment / in the recent future? Personally, Statelessness is the most interesting area, but I would consider other things as well.

I have ~15 years of experience as Software Engineer, last 1.5 years in blockchain/web3 space.

author: milos88
content:
I recently learned about Protocol Fellowship and seams like it might be good fit for me. Any idea when 5th cohort is expected to start?
I think I can contribute and get up to speed on my own (with some minimum guide), so I would rather not wait for 5th cohort if it is too far away.

author: sky.cactus
content: The Portal Network is stateless adjacent and they have their own Discord server if that interests you. At the least, I recommend looking into it.

author: sky.cactus
content: Are you looking for paid work or open source (unpaid) projects?

author: finncf
content: Portal Network is related to ENS smart contracts right? or is it built into the spec?

author: finncf
content: just checking it out now looks cool

author: milos88
content: Is their Discord server public (and can I get the link) or restricted to developers (in that case, how to reach out to them)?

author: milos88
content: I'm not sure I can commit full-time for the next few months (let's say until the end of the year), so I was planning to use that time to learn about project(s) and get up to speed. And if everything goes ok, to transition to full-time and also get paid.

author: sky.cactus
content: It has nothing to do with ENS.
